N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.162 - Executive order no. 162: declaring a disaster emergency in the counties of nassau, suffolk, westchester and rockland counties and the city of new york and contiguous areas

State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on December 10, 1992, a severe winter
storm with high winds has caused coastal and inland flooding, has endangered
lives and caused personal hardship, and has caused extensive damage to
residential and commercial properties; and
WHEREAS, this storm has resulted in the interruption of
essential public services and utilities, severe coastal erosion, the
destruction of flood prevention structures, and the disruption of vital
transportation networks in Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester and Rockland Counties, the City of New York and contiguous areas; NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, do hereby find that a disaster has occurred for which the affected
local governments are unable to respond adequately. Therefore, pursuant to the
authority vested in me by the Constitution of the State of New York and Section
28 of Article 2-B of the Executive Law, I hereby declare a State Disaster

Emergency effective December 10, 1992, within the territorial boundaries of

Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester and Rockland Counties, the City of New York and
their contiguous areas. FURTHER, pursuant to Section 29 of Article 2-B of the

Executive Law, I direct the implementation of the State Disaster Preparedness

Plan and authorize, effective December 10, 1992, the State Emergency Management

Office, the Department of Transportation, the Office of Parks and Recreation
and other State agencies as necessary, to take appropriate action to protect
state property and to assist those affected local governments and individuals
in restoring vital public utilities and transportation systems and in
responding to and recovering from this disaster, and to provide such other
assistance as necessary to protect the public health and safety. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: December 11, 1992
